data.title: Govt unity 'intact' despite Thaksin's criticism of some coalition parties
data.description: The ruling Pheu Thai Party has insisted the government

data.title: Hua Hin airport set to go 'international' next year
data.description: The Transport Ministry aims to upgrade Hua Hin Airport to be an international airport next year.

data.title: PM pitches Housing for Thais project
data.description: The government

data.title: Concrete beam falls onto Rama IV Road, no injuries
data.description: Three vehicles were damaged but no one was hurt when a  concrete beam  fell from a  crane  at a building demolition site on Rama IV Road near the Lumpini intersection in  Bangkok  on Saturday evening.

data.title: Floods continue to batter southern Thailand
data.description: Renewed  flooding  battered many areas in the southern provinces of  Surat Thani  and  Nakhon Si Thammarat  on Saturday and has claimed two lives so far.

data.title: Fleeing Chinese murder suspect caught in Phuket
data.description: PHUKET â€” A Chinese national suspected of murder in his home country has been arrested at Phuket airport after arriving on a flight from Shanghai to the Thai resort island.

data.title: Flash flood catches Chumphon residents off guard
data.description: Video has surfaced of  Chumphon  residents being caught off guard by  flash floods , with many dismayed to see their furniture set afloat.

data.title: Myanmar fishing boat seized in Thai waters
data.description: RANONG: A Myanmar fishing boat has been confiscated and its six crewmen arrested for smuggling in this southern province after 40,000 kilogrammes of salt-fermented shrimp were found on board.

data.title: Saudi tourist rescued after 5 hours at sea off Pattaya
data.description: A Saudi Arabian woman was rescued after five hours at sea following a jet ski accident off the coast of Pattaya.

data.title: B300bn allocated for six double-track railway projects
data.description: The Transport Ministry aims to invest almost 300 billion baht to expand a raft of double railway tracks next year.

data.title: At least 3 killed, scores injured in grenade attack at Tak fair
data.description: At least three people were killed and scores injured when a grenade was thrown into an annual fair in the Umphang district of northern Tak province late on Friday night. Two Karen teenagers were subsequently arrested.

data.title: Bare-knuckle politics
data.description: Bare-knuckle politics

data.title: Commission fears low turnout in polls
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) expressed concern over low voter turnout estimates for the nationwide election of Provincial Administrative Organisation (PAO) members to be held on Feb 1.

data.title: Cold climes on radar for two weeks
data.description: The temperature, especially in upper Thailand, is predicted to fall slightly until Dec 27 as a new high-pressure area is spreading into the upper part of the country, while the South is being warned to brace for more rain, the Thai Meteorological Department (TMD) said.

data.title: B300bn allocated for six dual-track railway projects
data.description: The Transport Ministry aims to invest almost 300 billion baht to expand a raft of dual railway tracks next year.

data.title: Premier's Malaysia trip to help boost ties
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will pay an official visit to Malaysia and co-chair the 7th annual consultation on Monday in Putrajaya, a city south of Kuala Lumpur, according to deputy government spokesperson Sasikarn Watthanachan.

data.title: 'Koh Kut sovereignty clear-cut'
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra insisted on Thai sovereignty over the island of Koh Kut in Trat, adding that the 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) regarding maritime claims in the Gulf of Thailand only serves as a framework for talks on the issue between Thailand and Cambodia.

data.title: Maris to visit Myanmar next week
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa will hold talks with Myanmar official next Thursday to expedite the release of four Thai fishermen, according to the Defence Ministry.

data.title: Murder victim's wife drops out of race
data.description: The widow of murder victim Chaimet Sitsanitphong, who had been eyed by Pheu Thai to run in Prachin Buri

data.title: Commission fears low turnout in polls
data.description: The Election Commission (EC) yesterday expressed concern over low voter turnout estimates for the nationwide election of Provincial Administrative Organisation (PAO) members to be held on Feb 1.

data.title: Thaksin says PM to lead new anti-drug task force
data.description: The government will set up a special task force chaired by the prime minister in a bid to combat the scourge of illicit drugs.

data.title: Palang Pracharath kicks out dissenting MPs
data.description: The Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) has officially expelled 20 MPs who defected following a dispute between former party secretary-general Thamanat Prompow and present party leader Prawit Wongsuwon.

data.title: Phu Kradueng reopening planned before Christmas
data.description: Phu Kradueng  National Park is expected to reopen before Dec 25 for tourists to celebrate the New Year holiday on the famous mountain in Loei province, officials said on Friday.

data.title: Asian scammers nabbed in Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA - A total of 13 Chinese and Korean suspects have been arrested in Pattaya for operating a  call centre scam .

data.title: Ratchaburi man busted with 50 rare exotic animals
data.description: A man has been arrested at his home in Ratchaburi for possessing dozens of  endangered wild animals  including cotton-top tamarin monkeys. He admitted to buying them online, police said on Friday.

data.title: Samui ferry operator considers lifting EV ban
data.description: SURAT THANI - The operator of ferries serving Koh Samui says it will reconsider lifting its ban on electric vehicles (EVs) early next year after installing firefighting equipment on all routes from the southern mainland to resort islands.

data.title: 12 beggars arrested in Bangkok,1 with B300,000 cash, B1m in bank account
data.description: Twelve Thai and foreign beggars were arrested during a police operation to purge Bangkok of beggars on Thursday night. One Thai beggar was found to be carrying more than 300,000 baht in cash and to have about one million baht in her bank account

data.title: Body of Thai man who jumped into river to escape Malaysian police found
data.description: NARATHIWAT - Rescuers found the body of a Thai citizen on Friday three days after he jumped into the Golok River to escape arrest by Malaysian police while trying to enter the neighbouring country through an illegal route.

data.title: Five members of Chinese-led 'scam network' arrested in Chon Buri
data.description: Five more alleged members of a Chinese scam network have been arrested and assets, including luxury houses and cars, worth 152 million baht seized during a raid in Bang Lamung district, Chon Buri.

data.title: Five members of Chinese-led 'scam network' arrested in Chon Buri
data.description: Five more alleged members of a Chinese scam network have been arrested and assets, including luxury houses and cars, worth 152 million baht seized during a raid in Bang Lamung district, Chon Buri.

data.title: Six arrested over call centre scams in southern Thailand
data.description: Police arrested six people allegedly involved in call centre scams and the illegal firearms trade, the Cyber Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) announced yesterday, saying the suspects may have also financed the insurgency in the deep South.
